text:
As the head of human resources of a French Groupement d'Intérêt Public (GIP), you can recruit and employ an agent under a private law regime, even if this agent is supposed to contribute to public service activities.

```markdown
As the head of human resources of a French Groupement d'Intérêt Public (GIP), you can recruit and employ an agent under a private law regime, even if this agent is supposed to contribute to public service activities.
```

This is because GIPs have the flexibility to hire employees under private law contracts, which can be advantageous for certain roles and responsibilities.
